common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Returning Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot being unresponsive, returning errors, or experiencing lag. Issues are often related to specific LLMs like Gemini and Claude or interactions with the OpenAI API.  Suggested workarounds include updating Pieces, switching LLMs, removing OpenAI keys, and waiting for the next PiecesOS update.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context issue with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o, system returns a response but requires the file to be included.
    * Line numbers wrapping issue.
* Support team member @mark-at-pieces reproduced the issues and confirmed context issue is due to the file not being included in the context.
* @sam-at-pieces proposes a fix for the context issue.
* @mark-at-pieces confirms the context issue is resolved and will be released in Pieces 11.0.4.

**Problems Identified:**

* Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o model has context issue with specific file.
* Line numbers wrapping incorrectly.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Team is working on a fix for the context issue.
* Line wrapping issue will be investigated by @mack-at-pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Context issue fix is included in Pieces 11.0.4.
* Line wrapping issue investigation ongoing.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Some users are experiencing issues with the "Claude" and "Gemini" large language models.
* These issues appear to be related to the integration of OpenAI API keys.
* Removing the OpenAI API key has been reported to resolve the issues.

**Problems identified:**

* The "Claude" and "Gemini" models are not functioning properly for some users.
* The cause of the problem is related to the integration of OpenAI API keys.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Users are advised to switch to the "GPT4o" model.
* Ensure Pieces is updated to version 11.0.3.
* Ensure you are signed in to Pieces to benefit from a higher rate limit.
* If issues persist, switch to an OpenAI model.
* Removing the OpenAI API key has been reported to work for some users.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be ongoing.
* Removing the OpenAI API key is a temporary workaround.
* The root cause of the problem is still being investigated.

**Additional notes:**

* Registering your OpenAI API key is currently not recommended.
* The developer is actively investigating the issue.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

*  @gittydia reported an issue with their Pieces Copilot.
*  The issue involved an error message: "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please try again later."
*  The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces support team.

**Problems Identified:**

*  Pieces Copilot was not functioning as expected.
*  The specific error message provided limited information about the underlying cause.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

*  The Pieces support team identified a potential fix within the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.
*  The user was asked to report back if the issue persists after the release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

*  The fix is scheduled for release no later than Thursday (2025-01-16).
*  The user will provide further feedback after the release to confirm if the issue is resolved.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing high RAM/CPU usage with PiecesOS, potentially linked to internet connectivity. Short-term solutions include restarting the application and disabling Live Context. The Pieces team is actively working on optimizing performance and resolving these issues in future updates.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Pieces POS High Memory Usage - GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* High memory usage by Pieces POS, exceeding 5GB and causing performance issues.
* Some users report the usage exceeding 2GB even when not actively using Pieces.
* High CPU usage also reported, impacting system performance.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leaks in Pieces POS.
* High resource consumption due to ML models and Live Context feature.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Optimize Memory feature to unload unused ML models and free RAM.
* Ongoing improvements to make Pieces POS more performant.
* Live Context can be disabled to reduce resource usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Pieces POS generally uses around 2GB of resources.
* High resource usage issues are still being addressed.
* Users experiencing usage beyond 2GB can schedule a call for troubleshooting.
* Some users have stopped using Pieces due to the resource consumption.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue conversation is ongoing and the problem has not been fully resolved.
* The development team is actively working on improving performance and resource usage.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code Extension Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting the VS Code extension to Pieces OS, particularly within remote environments like WSL2 and DevContainers. This is often due to network configurations and Pieces Server's listening interface. Solutions include configuring custom URLs, enabling specific WSL2 features, and upgrading to the latest extension version that offers automatic detection and improved compatibility.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* The root cause of the issue might be related to WSL2 network problems.
* The `systemd` option and `dns-tunnel` might help resolve the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces VSCode extension cannot properly render the Copilot in WSL2.
* The health check API returns "ok", indicating the extension is connected to Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Enabling the `systemd` option in WSL2.
* Enabling the `dns-tunnel` feature in WSL2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solutions haven't been implemented yet.
* Further investigation is needed to determine if the issue is related to WSL2 or snap installation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's /etc/wsl.conf file already includes the `systemd=true` flag.
* The networking mode is set to "mirrored".

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * User is experiencing connection issues when trying to access Pieces OS through the VSCode extension within a remote DevContainer. * The issue appears to be related to the default listening interface of Pieces Server, which has been changed for security reasons in version 11.0.0. * The current listening interface is loopback, which prevents connections from the remote DevContainer. **Problems Identified:** * The Pieces Server is not listening on the address provided by the user. * `host.docker.internal` resolution does not work with the Copilot webview tool windows. * The user cannot access Pieces OS through the VSCode extension. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Issue a patch to allow listening on all interfaces. * Release a new version of the VSCode extension that automatically detects Pieces OS and removes the need for a custom URL. * Provide a workaround involving creating a DNS name entry for `pieceshost`. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Version 2.0.2 of the Pieces for VSCode extension has been released, resolving the issue. * The user is able to connect to Pieces OS through the VSCode extension. **Additional Notes:** * The user was experiencing additional issues unrelated to the reported problem. * A video call was scheduled to address the remaining issues. **Overall, the user's issue was successfully resolved with the release of the new extension version.**

related_issues.title: Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
related_issues.text:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
### Software

Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome browser slows to a crawl while hundreds of these errors are issued:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health   

Disabling the extension stops it, re-enabling invokes it again
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* SteveW555 created an issue regarding Chrome Extension filling Developer Console with Errors.
* The issue was automatically assigned to the proper Pieces team member.
* Similar issues were suggested: 
>* *Multiple well-known/health api call during reload*
>* *Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors*
* Resources were provided for SteveW555: 
>* *Existing Issues*
>* *Documentation*
>* *YouTube Channel*

**Problems Identified:**

* Chrome Extension fills Developer Console with Errors.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue will be fixed in the upcoming release of the extension.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed as a duplicate of https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/562.
* The fix is expected to be released within a day or two.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Launch and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various issues with the Pieces Desktop App, including failure to launch, crashes, and unresponsive features.  These issues appear across different operating systems and Pieces OS versions. Proposed solutions include checking for updates, reviewing log files, and providing system information for troubleshooting. Some issues are under investigation by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS Launch Failure

**Problem:** Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS on both Windows and macOS. 

**Key Points:**

* The issue appears to be widespread, affecting users across different operating systems and versions.
* Users report various symptoms:
    * Button greying out and returning to normal without launching (Windows)
    * Blue outline window instead of the full app (Windows)
    * "Failed to connect to Pieces OS" error when using the web extension (macOS)
    * Issue only occurs with Pieces OS, Pieces for Developers works as expected
* The problem seems to have persisted for several months with no apparent resolution.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Check log files for potential clues.
* Ensure Microsoft App Installer is up to date.
* Investigate potential links to other reported issues.
* Share system information for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status:**

* Unresolved.
* Developers are acknowledged the issue and are investigating.
* No updates have been provided since January 2025.

**Further Actions:**

* Users experiencing the issue can provide additional information:
    * Specific error messages
    * System logs
    * Screenshots
    * Steps to reproduce the problem
* Monitor the Github issue for updates from the developers.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces Copilot Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve issues related to Pieces Copilot unresponsiveness, errors, and lag. Focus on specific LLMs like Gemini and Claude, and interactions with the OpenAI API.

**Address PiecesOS Performance:** Investigate and optimize PiecesOS to reduce RAM/CPU usage. Explore potential links to internet connectivity and prioritize solutions for both short-term mitigation (e.g., improved guidance on disabling Live Context) and long-term resolution.

**Improve VS Code Extension Connectivity:** Provide clearer documentation and solutions for connecting the VS Code extension to Pieces OS in remote environments (WSL2, DevContainers). Highlight the latest extension version with automatic detection and improved compatibility.

**Investigate Neural Code Search Failures:** Allocate resources to diagnose and resolve issues with Neural Code Search not returning results or getting stuck connecting. Update documentation with potential workarounds and known issues.

**Review Desktop App Launch Issues:** Investigate and address issues with the Pieces Desktop App failing to launch, crashing, and experiencing unresponsive features. Prioritize solutions based on operating system and Pieces OS version.
**Gather More Data on Unclear Issues:** For issues like ticket #456 ("Not Working"), encourage users to provide more detailed descriptions, screenshots, and logs to aid in troubleshooting.

**Proactive Communication:** Provide regular updates on known issues and expected resolution timelines through release notes, blog posts, or a dedicated status page. This will help manage user expectations and reduce support ticket volume for known problems.

**Enhance Issue Triaging:** Improve the automatic triaging system to ensure tickets are routed to the appropriate team members more efficiently. This may involve refining the keywords and categories used for categorization.

**Knowledge Base Expansion:** Expand the knowledge base with articles and FAQs addressing common issues and their solutions. This will empower users to self-serve and potentially reduce the number of support tickets submitted.
